This event offers an in-depth exploration of the H-1B and O-1 visa categories, providing attendees with valuable insights into securing and maintaining these visas in today's dynamic environment.\n\nDiscussion Topics:\n\nH-1B Visa: Designed for workers in specialty occupations, the H-1B visa requires a higher education degree or its equivalent. It encompasses roles in fields such as IT, finance, engineering, and more.\n\nO-1 Visa: Intended for individuals with extraordinary ability or achievement in fields like sciences, arts, education, business, or athletics, the O-1 visa recognizes those who have attained national or international acclaim.\n\nPanelists:\n\nSampei Omichi: A first-generation immigrant, Sampei avoided deportation by establishing a business within 60 days. Overcoming challenges unique to underrepresented groups in tech, including navigating implicit biases, breaking through communication barriers, and leading effectively\n\nAgenda\n\n6:00 PM - Reception\nCheck into the event, and enjoy food & drinks while networking with other engineering leaders.\n\n6:30 PM - Lightning Talks\nEngage with two short 15 minute presentations on the event topic by:\n\n- Christine Choi - Senior Staff Data Scientist @ LinkedIn\n- Nitya Shekar - Executive Coach & Founder of Second Wind Group\n\n7:25 PM -  Panel Discussion + Live Q&A\nDeep dive into the topic of the event and direct your live questions to: \n\n- Christine Choi - Senior Staff Data Scientist @ LinkedIn\n- Nitya Shekar - Executive Coach & Founder of Second Wind Group\n- Yannie Yip - Engineering Manager @ Asana\n- Jin Zhang - Director of Engineering @ Meta\n\nModerated by:\n\n- Siri Kostanyan - Co-organizer @ Engineering Leadership NYC\n\nMC'ed by:\n\n- Alegria Baquero - Engineering Manager @ Zocdoc\n\n8:10 PM - Networking\nMake new connections & continue the discussion with fellow leaders until 8:30pm.\n\nAbout Engineering Leadership NYC\n\nEngineering Leadership NYC is a community for Engineering Managers, Directors, VPs, and Staff+ Engineers working in the software industry. The organization hosts in-person events focused on fostering connections, sharing experiences, and building professional relationships. Through curated topics, panel discussions, and networking opportunities, we provide a space for leaders to navigate the challenges of engineering management and leadership together.\n\nAbout LinkedIn\n\nFounded in 2003, LinkedIn connects the world's professionals to make them more productive and successful. We‚Äôve hosted 11 sessions in three countries‚ÄîNew York, San Francisco, and Toronto‚Äîwelcoming more than 2,000 attendees. Every BTS follows Chatham House Rule, with a strict no-phone, no-photo, no-video policy‚Äîso people say what they really think. The result? Conversations that simply don‚Äôt happen anywhere else.\n\nWith special guests like Annie Jacobson, whose reporting on national security and nuclear history reads like science fiction, and Shawn Fanning, whose early bets on inconceivable futures helped reshape the internet, we‚Äôll pull back the curtain on what‚Äôs coming‚Äîand what it takes to tell a story powerful enough to shape the future.\n\nThis event is a part of #NYTechWeek‚Äîa week of events hosted by VCs and startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. In our New York chapter, we host a monthly dinner and an inclusive poker night, plus virtual programs like Office Hours and Pitch Coaching to connect founders nationwide. Learn more at startuphaven.com. \n\nStartup Haven Premium Events: Founders Dinner and Startup Poker 2.0\n\nThis event is free for Startup Haven Level 1 & Level 2 members, but Level 0 members have a cost of $10.00. If you would like to attend this (and future) premium events for free, upgrade to Level 1 ($10/month) or Level 2 ($30/month) here:¬† (UPGRADE http://member.startuphaven.com/sys/membershiplevelchange)\n\nStartup Haven events are (usually) exclusively for our founder and investor members.\n\nIf you are interested in joining Startup Haven as a free member, you can indicate that in your registration questions! \n\nSafety Concerns If you have safety concerns and would like someone to accompany you to your vehicle, we would be happy to accommodate you, just let one of our team members know or email us in advance at membership@startuphaven.com. Thank you! If you are sick, or have loved ones that are vulnerable, please consider coming to future events instead.¬†\n\nSponsors Make it Happen\n\nThank you to our venue sponsor WorkHouse! WorkHouse has 18 different meeting room spaces over 12 floors for member use and a variety of event spaces. Each space is uniquely designed and curated.\n\nStartup Haven and these events would not be possible without the support of our awesome sponsors.¬† They buy all the food, drink, poker chips, cards, trophies, etc. so please thank them when you see them!\n\nInclusivity\n\nWe acknowledge that poker, as well as the tech and startup community, has historically been male-dominated. However, we are committed to creating a welcoming and inclusive environment for all members and players. \n\nWe strongly encourage women, people of color, and individuals from all under-recognized groups to join us at our events. \n\nYour presence enriches the experience for everyone, and we are dedicated to ensuring that our poker community is diverse, respectful, and inclusive.\n\nRead here (https://medium.com/@bcrimmins/why-every-startup-founder-should-play-poker-1-of-3-94a5f543170a) for more about why we play poker at Startup Haven, and believe that poker is for everyone. \n\nThis event is a part of #NYTechWeek‚Äîa week of events hosted by VCs and startups to bring together the tech ecosystem.     "event_name": "The Performance Marketing Trap. How to avoid killing your business with performance marketing.",
    "start_time": "Monday, June 2, 2025 at 9:30 PM EDT",
    "neighborhood": "SoHo",
    "url": "https://partiful.com/e/CYfTqxiVskYk1Ww9UQGv",
    "hosts": "GrowTal",
    "target_audiences": "Founders ($1-5M Raised), Investors",
    "themes": "B2C / Consumer, SaaS, B2B",
    "formats": "Roundtable / Workshop",
    "description": "After working with 100‚Äôs of businesses to raise hundreds of millions in capital and through several exits we have seen how marketing can make or break a business. \n\nAll too often businesses get caught in the allure of simplicity in performance marketing only to fall into the same patterns of behavior that drives up costs, reduced profitability and ultimately leads to failure. \n\nJoin Bryan Karas, founder of Playbook Media & GrowTal, to get the ultimate crash course on the mistakes that kill businesses at all stages of business and the strategies you can implement to drive profitable growth for your business. \n\nIn this course we will cover the following topics with breakout sessions lead by guest CMO‚Äôs and heads of growth to provide tangible benefits that you can begin implementing in your business immediately. \n\nICP & Product-Market Fit: \nYour ICP defines who you‚Äôre targeting, and product-market fit means you're confirming that your product meets a specific need in your target market. Together, they ensure your marketing resonates, empathizes, and converts new users.\n\nMarginal returns and Avoiding the Waste of Averages: \nPerformance marketing offers immediate returns and easy attribution -- but's without assessing incrementality, it's often fool's gold that accelerates burn rate without adding much actual value. Make sure you're measuring what counts and optimizing your budget accordingly. \n\nPerformance Branding & True Emotional Connection: \nPerformance marketing drives action, but brand builds connection ‚Äî and lasting growth happens when you combine both. To truly scale, you need more than optimized ads; you need an true emotional connection that makes people care, trust, and come back. The bonus: a strong brand is a growth moat your competitors can't easily overcome.\n\nHiring the Right People: \nPerhaps more than any of the above, hiring the wrong people at the wrong time is the kiss of death for startups. Different growth stages and challenges require different skills, and alignment is key to healthy growth.\n\nThis event is a part of #NYTechWeek‚Äîa week of events hosted by VCs and startups to bring together the tech ecosystem.
